required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized, Sham Device Controlled, Single Blinded Trial of Portable Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation and Heat Therapy Machine in Women With Dysmenorrhea

oversight_info.authority: Korea: Korean Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis is that a transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation and heat therapy machine could reduce dysmenorrhea in women with primary or secondary dysmenorrhea.

detailed_description.textblock: Inclusion/Exclusion: Described in Eligibility section. Outcome measures: Change of VAS score before and after use of TENS and heat therapy machine.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change of VAS before and after application of machine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before application of machine and 20minutes after application of machine
primary_outcome.description: Measure the change% of VAS between before application of machine (T0) and 20 minutes after application of machine (T20) in every episode of dysmenorrhea during 1 menstrual cycle The mean of change% of VAS is primary outcome measure

intervention.other_name: Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation and heat therapy machine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion
- Age>19
- Premenopausal
- Moderate or severe dysmenorrhea, mainly in low abdomen area
Exclusion
- Pregnant
- Surgery history on lower abdomen
- Recent history of cancer
- TENS device use is contraindicated
- Ibuprofen use is contraindicated
